properties.name: Aloha hostel
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse Reputed inexpensive hostel

properties.name: Cabo San Lucas
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse cabo san lucasFishing village in the 1980s preparing for new cruise ship terminal. Beautiful beachs and rock outcroppings. Ate sardines from the can with Dan Jameson at the southernmost point. Nice hostel up the road from village with iguana for a roommate (in bathroom). Giggling Marlin bartender wanted to practice English with us while we were looking for a cheap place to drink beer.

properties.name: Cafe Voltaire/formerly Lulu's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse  first street, benicia, ca 94510Fair trade and organic coffeehouse opening July 14. Small business which has changed hands over the years. Coffeeshop that sells fresh-roasted coffee beans from Duvall Roasting Co. located in the Tannery Bldg.

properties.name: Cold Spring Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse5995 Stagecoach Road, santa barbaraRomantic spot.

properties.name: HI
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse925 H Street, Sacramento, CAOld-fashion free-standing Victorian in downtown Sacramento. Divided up into dorms and private rooms upstairs. Shared kitchen, dining room, parlor and reception on ground floor. Laundry downstairs.

properties.name: Los Mochis
properties.description: Posted by Anymouselos mochisTrain station with connections to Topolobampo and up to Copper Canyon (I think).

properties.name: Mexicali, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by AnymousemexicaliDesert town with railroad station. Arrived by bus from Tijuana and went to buy train tickets for Los Mochis. Long line of people sleeping outside station. Didn\'t realize train left only every other day. People waiting to purchase tickets in morning for next train. Ate street tacos (small, soft double corn tortillas with a teaspoon of meat) for the first time.

properties.name: Proposed Starbucks (Downtown)
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse  This is the location of the proposed Starbucks in downtown Benicia (in Harborwalk project)

properties.name: Proposed Starbucks in Safeway
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse This is the location of the proposed Starbucks in downtown Benicia (in the existing Safeway supermarket)

properties.name: San Blas, Narayit
properties.description: Posted by Anymousesan blas, mexicoDusty, jungle village with warm ocean waters. Former customshouse near port. Fried fish shacks on the beachs. Expats who play bridge on a card table. A dog called Medianoches running around on the sand. A restaurant called McDonald\'s where I went for breakfasts. Workers in front of the doorway throwing bricks up to the second floor. Suddenly, shouts and everybody runs away as bricks fall back down to the street. No one wearing a helmet or gloves.

properties.name: Site of Darcy's Coffeehouse
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse This was the location of a great local coffeehouse serving breakfasts and lunches. Homemade tamales on Fridays were a specialty.

properties.name: Site of proposed Wal-Mart Supercenter in American Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse  85268This was farmland. A building under construction is proposed to become a Wal-Mart Supercenter.

properties.name: Site of proposed Wal-Mart Supercenter in Vallejo
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse  85268This was the site of the old K-Mart Building. It is now proposed to become a Wal-Mart Supercenter.

properties.name: Site of the old Capitol Building in Vallejo
properties.description: Posted by AnymouseThis was the location of the building used as California State Capitol in the early 1850\'s.

properties.name: Tepic
properties.description: Posted by AnymousetepicRegional capital with government employees, businessmen and neat, clean streets. Train station and bus to San Blas.

properties.name: Thursday vigil in Benicia against the war
properties.description: Posted by Anymouse first street, benicia, ca 94510Weekly demonstration against the war in Iraq. Each Thursday from 5-6pm on the sidewalk near the gazebo.

properties.name: Tijuana, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by AnymousetijuanaNotorious border town that is both seedy and commercial, desperate and loaded. Starting point for trip to Mexicali. Ending point of all night bus ride from Cabo San Lucas. Second class seats saved us a few pesos, but nearly broke our backs on hot rear seats rumbling next to engine. Stopped at midnight in a shitfield next to road to relieve ourselves under the stars.

properties.name: Topolobampo
properties.description: Posted by AnymousetopolobampoTook a cab with Dan Jameson to ferry terminal, tried to give driver a tip, underpaid him and had to return to town because ferry didn\'t leave until next day.
